title: Mutual Annihilation of Tiles
abstract:
Given $A\subset\mathbb Z_n^2$, the purpose of this article is to investigate
when is the difference set $\Delta A$ disjoint with the zero set of the Fourier
transform of $A$. In the study of tiles in $\mathbb Z_n^2$, the author observed
an interesting phenomenon that if $(A,B)$ is a tiling pair with $|A|=|B|$, then
sometimes $(A,B)$ is also a spectral pair and vice versa. Moreover, in such
cases actually one of the components would have universality (i.e., it is the
universal spectrum/tiling complement for its tiling complements/spectra). It
turns out that the disjointness is the critical property here, and shall be
analyzed using the symplectic Fourier transform. Under such configuration it is
shown that the phenomenon persists either (1) if $A$ is an order $n$ subgroup,
or (2) if $n$ is a prime number and $A$ complements an order $n$ subgroup, or
(3) if $n=p^2$, and $A$ complements the non-cyclic order $n$ subgroup.
